New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers improved to 14-0, the first time since the Golden State Warriors in 2015-16 and the longest winning streak in the team's 55-year history.
Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points, and the Cavaliers set a franchise record for points in a quarter with 49 in the first.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points and contributed 18 points in the final 12 minutes.
Cleveland's 14-game winning streak is the longest in the club's history.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls struggled with rushed shots and poor possessions.
The Cavaliers played without starting forward Evan Mobley, who was battling an illness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers continued their perfect start under first-year coach Kenny Atkinson.
